primary_content.title: Our Preclinical Expertise
primary_content.description:
Mechanical thrombectomy devices must demonstrate effective clot engagement and retrieval while navigating tortuous cerebrovascular anatomy without damaging fragile vessel walls. Stent retrievers require validation of expansion dynamics that capture thrombus material while preventing distal embolization from clot fragmentation. Device tracking through internal carotid siphon tortuosity and middle cerebral artery angulation demands pushability and flexibility characterization across representative anatomical geometries.

We evaluate thrombectomy performance using anatomically accurate cerebrovascular phantoms replicating circle of Willis geometry while standardized synthetic clot formulations representing acute ischemic stroke thrombi enable reproducible testing. Our catheterization laboratories feature high-resolution biplane fluoroscopy and flow circuits simulating cerebral hemodynamics that capture clot-device interaction dynamics. Specialized protocols quantify first-pass recanalization rates, retrieval force optimization, and embolic fragment generation using downstream particle capture systems.

FDA guidance for neurothrombectomy devices requires both bench testing demonstrating mechanical performance and animal studies evaluating vessel wall safety. ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide blood-contacting component assessment while device-specific protocols address navigation through representative cerebrovascular tortuosity. Our GLP-compliant testing supports 510(k) pathways under product code POL and NRY classifications. Whether validating next-generation stent retrievers or combined aspiration-retrieval platforms, our protocols generate data addressing FDA expectations for Class II neurovascular mechanical thrombectomy devices.

capabilities.title: Clot Engagement and Retrieval Force Characterization
capabilities.description: Standardized synthetic clot formulations representing fibrin-rich and red blood cell-rich thrombi enable consistent engagement testing while force sensors quantify retrieval mechanics and optimal pull speeds for complete clot capture.

capabilities.title: First-Pass Recanalization Assessment
capabilities.description: Controlled testing protocols measure single-attempt revascularization success rates across clot compositions and anatomical configurations while tracking procedural time metrics that correlate with clinical outcomes.

capabilities.title: Cerebrovascular Navigation Testing
capabilities.description: Anatomically accurate phantoms replicate internal carotid siphon, middle cerebral artery branching, and basilar artery geometry while quantifying trackability, pushability, and device conformability through challenging neurovascular access routes.

capabilities.title: Distal Embolization Quantification
capabilities.description: Downstream particle capture systems measure embolic fragment generation during clot retrieval while particle size analysis characterizes fragmentation patterns that determine periprocedural stroke risk.

capabilities.title: Vessel Wall Interaction Assessment
capabilities.description: In vivo animal studies evaluate endothelial damage, vessel wall stress, and tissue response following device deployment and retrieval using histopathological analysis of treated arterial segments.

capabilities.title: Radial Force and Expansion Dynamics
capabilities.description: Specialized fixtures measure stent retriever radial force throughout expansion range while high-speed imaging captures deployment dynamics and clot integration mechanics under simulated blood flow conditions.
